articles.title: OpenAI's Sam Altman to brief US officials on 'PhD-level' AI agents
articles.author: Nathan Drescher
articles.summary: According to reports, OpenAI CEO Sam Altman will give a demonstration of a PhD-level artificial intelligence agent to US federal officials on January 30th. AI is already having an impact on people's jobs. Mark Zuckerberg and Marc Benioff plan to reduce hiring and replace workers with AI.

articles.title: Galaxy AI: Unleashing User Creativity on Galaxy S Ultra
articles.author: archyde
articles.summary: Samsung has unveiled Galaxy AI, a new technology that allows users to express themselves in new ways. Dr. Amplify, Samsung's AI innovator, spoke with Archyde about the inspiration behind Galaxy AI. Samsung promises to reveal even more details about this technology at the Galaxy Unpacked event on January 23rd, the same day the latest Galaxy S series launches.

articles.title: AI Under Watch: New Developments in New York and California Push Businesses Toward AI Transparency and Compliance
articles.author: archyde
articles.summary: As the influence of artificial intelligence (AI) grows, so too does the need for clear regulations to ensure responsible and ethical development and deployment. California passed the California AI Transparency Act (S.B. 942), set to take effect in 2026. New York Governor Kathy Hochul announced an amendment to the state's Worker adjustment and Retraining Notification Act to require businesses with 50 or more employees to report AI-driven layoffs.

articles.title: AI chatbots still can't accurately answer high-level history questions: study
articles.author: New York Post
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence excels at tasks like coding and podcast generation, but it struggles to answer high-level history questions. Researchers tested OpenAI's GPT-4, Meta's Llama and Google's Gemini using LlMs. They found that they lack the depth required for advanced history.

articles.title: 'I'M STUNNED': Paul Schrader, writer of 'Taxi Driver,' admits AI is better than people at generating film ideas
articles.author: Ilana Gordon
articles.summary: ChatGPT, a new type of search engine, has come up with an idea for a movie pitch for Paul Schrader. Schrader is a film critic, director, and screenwriter. He is best known for Taxi Driver (1976), Raging Bull (1980), and The Last Temptation of Christ (1988). He is also known for directing The Canyons (2013) starring Lindsay Lohan and James Deen.

articles.title: OpenAI's agent tool may be nearing release
articles.author: Kyle Wiggers
articles.summary: OpenAI's ChatGPT client for Mac has added shortcuts to 'Toggle Operator' and 'Force Quit Operator' on its website. Leaked benchmarks show Operator's performance is not up to par with human-level. The market for AI agents could be worth $47.1 billion by 2030.

articles.title: OpenAI's agent tool may be nearing release
articles.author: News Feed Editor
articles.summary: Tibor Blaho claims to have found evidence of OpenAI's long-rumored Operator AI tool. The tool is capable of autonomously handling tasks like writing code and booking travel. The Information reports that OpenAI is targeting January as Operator's release month.

articles.title: Here's how AI graded President Trump's inauguration speech
articles.author: Taylor Soper
articles.summary: President Trump's inauguration speech could have been 36% more concise and offered more clarity on execution, according to Yoodli, a Seattle startup that uses AI to analyze speech and offer tips for improving communication skills. Other AI tools such as ChatGPT also offers quick summarization and analysis.

articles.title: Duke Health using AI in doctor's office
articles.author: WRAL
articles.summary: Thousands of Duke Health clinicians are using artificial intelligence to provide health care using machine learning technology at Duke Health's facility.   ¬†  √Ç  ‚ÄúArtificial Intelligence for Health Care‚Äù by Mark Bergin, Grace Hayba, and Mark Hayba.

articles.title: ‚ÄòThe Brutalist' Director Speaks Out After AI Controversy Erupts
articles.author: Forbes
articles.summary: 'The Brutalist' director Brady Corbet addresses the backlash caused by the revelation that AI was used in parts of the film's creation. He denies using AI in any of the movie's scenes.    "Brutalist" is a film about the use of artificial intelligence.

articles.title: You Still Here? Tuesday, January 21, 2025
articles.summary: Siri might not understand your accent, according to Cowboy State Daily Staff's survey.    (Cowboy State Daily staff)   January 20, 2017.  (cowboy statedaily.com)  ( cowboystatedaily.uk)

articles.title: AI in Homework: Tool for Learning or Shortcut for Cheating?
articles.author: This is Local London
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence (AI) is transforming education, especially when it comes to homework. Trinity Catholic High School students are divided on whether AI is a valuable learning tool or a shortcut that undermines their education. A survey by the National Literacy Trust revealed that the proportion of 13 to 18 year-olds using generative AI rose from 37.1% in 2023 to 77% in 2024 in the UK.

articles.title: USA Health to close all offices, clinics due to potential winter weather
articles.author: BRADY PETREE
articles.summary: USA Health offices and clinic locations in Mobile and Baldwin counties will be closed on Tuesday, Jan. 21 and on Wednesday morning. A potentially historic winter weather system is moving toward the Alabama Gulf Coast and USA Health is joining a host of businesses and organizations in closing up shop during the middle of this week.

articles.title: AI-driven image retargeting: Predicting dimensions for seamless display across different devices
articles.author: Saad Lotfi
articles.summary: Scientists at Sharjah University developed a technique to automatically predict suitable image dimensions to fit different screens or devices more efficiently and effectively than current technologies used for image cropping and resizing. The deep learning models the scientists propose in their research are based on transfer learning devices, such as Resnet18, DenseNet121, and InceptionV3.

articles.title: The Galaxy S25 Countdown Begins: What to Expect During the Samsung Unpacked Event and How ...
articles.author: CNET
articles.summary: The event will focus on the Galaxy S series and AI, as well as Samsung's upcoming Galaxy S5 and Galaxy S6 smartphones.   ¬†Here's everything to know ahead of the event. ¬†  √Ç   iReport.com.

articles.title: The Brutalist Director Addresses AI Use in the Film
articles.author: archyde
articles.summary: Adrien Brody's performance in 'The Brutalist' has been generating buzz, because of the use of AI to enhance his Hungarian accent. Dr. Amelia Hart is a leading linguistics expert and AI specialist. She believes that the future holds a dynamic landscape where AI will become increasingly integrated into the process, assisting actors in their craft.

articles.title: Mastering 2025: The AI Revolution is getting real
articles.author: Dillon Lowe
articles.summary: Baton Rouge-area companies are investing in artificial intelligence. Our Lady of the Lake Health is set to launch its own AI platform in early 2025. BASF's Geismar plant is preparing to launch an AI product that will allow it to search through millions of site-specific documents in record time.

articles.title: Jenifer's Shelter Island Journal: Humans only
articles.author: Jenifer Maxson
articles.summary: Ambrose Clancy's column was supposed to be about the tyranny of technology, but it turned out to be a discussion of the relationship between humans and artificial intelligence. Ambrose has been repeating himself every January since he began writing the column. Ambrose is glad that the original topic fell into place.

articles.title: Meta Is Building AI That Can Write Code Like a Mid-Level Engineer, According to Mark Zuckerberg
articles.author: Sherin Shibu
articles.summary: OpenAI is reportedly set to announce an AI breakthrough in the coming weeks. CEO Sam Altman has scheduled a closed-door briefing with the U.S. government in Washington D.C. on January 30. Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg revealed earlier this month that Meta is working on an AI that can replace mid-level engineers at the company in 2025. Meta is laying off more than 3,000 people.

articles.title: ServiceNow To Buy Conversational Data Company Cuein
articles.author: Amit Chowdhry
articles.summary: ServiceNow has agreed to acquire Cuein, a leader in AI native conversation data analysis and insights. Cuein will help advance the effectiveness of ServiceNow's AI Agents. The acquisition is expected to close in Q1 of 2025. The terms of the deal were undisclosed.

articles.title: 'The Brutalist' sparks backlash for use of AI, director Brady Corbet responds
articles.summary: Brady Corbet -directed The Brutalis is causing a stir after the film's editor, D√°vid Jancs√≥, revealed artificial intelligence was used to enhance the performances of Adrien Brody and Felicity Jones in the film. He said the filmmakers used AI to change their Hungarian dialogue to make it sound more authentic.

articles.title: AI Fails: Look What It Did to Idaho's Craters of the Moon
articles.author: Nate Bird Nate Bird Published:
articles.summary: Artificial Intelligence is a growing entity that learns new things each day. Some AI creations are good and convincing, but not all of them are. The pictures posted on social media of Craters of the Moon National Monument in Idaho look nothing like the real thing.

articles.title: Open-source DeepSeek-R1 uses pure reinforcement learning to match OpenAI o1 ‚Äî at 95% less cost
articles.summary: Chinese AI startup, DeepSeek, has released an enhanced version of its R1 model. The new model is on par with OpenAI's o1-1217. It scored 79.8% on AIME 2024 mathematics tests and 97.3% on MATH-500. It also achieved a 2,029 rating on Codeforces, better than 96.3%.

articles.title: How to spot an AI generated video
articles.author: Roger Fingas
articles.summary: It's important to spot AI videos on social media platforms like Facebook, Telegram, and WhatsApp when they appear. Some platforms have started adding watermarks to AI videos. Some social networks have ways of automatically detecting AI-generated content and flagging it. The best-known way of spotting an AI video is by looking at a person's fingers.

articles.title: The Brutalist and Emilia Perez's voice-cloning controversies make AI the new awards season battleground
articles.author: The Observer
articles.summary: At least two major contenders used voice-cloning to enhance actors' performances during the movie awards season, according to a report in "Maggie" magazine. The use of artificial intelligence could become a ferocious battleground during the awards season as at least two contenders were revealed to have used it.

articles.title: Things You Need to Know About Autonomous Vehicles
articles.author: Jordan OMalley
articles.summary: Autonomous vehicles (AVs) are transforming how we think about driving, the environment, and even our cities. This guide offers 13 things you need to know about autonomous vehicles.   ¬†   i.e. what AVs are all about and how they will change our society.

articles.title: Knowing less about AI makes people more open to having it in their lives‚Äînew research
articles.author: Chiara Longoni
articles.summary: People with less knowledge about AI are more open to using the technology. People with higher AI literacy focus on AI's efficiency rather than its magical qualities. Efforts to boost AI literacy might dampen people's enthusiasm for using AI by making it seem less magical. Businesses, educators and policymakers need to strike this balance.

articles.title: E-commerce Revolution: AI Agents Transform Visual Content Creation
articles.author: World News Wire 21st
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence is revolutionizing how online retailers approach visual content creation. AI-powered solutions are enabling businesses to reduce production times by up to 70%. Small and medium-sized businesses struggle to compete in an increasingly visual marketplace. Dresma is an e-commerce content creation platform that has processed over 9 million product images to date.

articles.title: 4 expert insights on AI adoption across nonprofits in 2025
articles.author: Brandpoint
articles.summary: Rahul Rao is the co-president and chief technology officer at Understood.org, a leading nonprofit empowering 70 million people with learning and thinking differences. He predicts a surge in AI adoption among nonprofits in 2025, driven by growing visibility in the benefits of AI and integration of AI into the tools people use every day.

articles.title: 4 expert insights on AI adoption across nonprofits in 2025
articles.author: Brandpoint
articles.summary: AI has proven to help people increase their productivity and impact at work. Rahul Rao is co-president and chief technology officer at Understood.org, a leading nonprofit empowering 70 million people in the United States with learning and thinking differences like ADHD and dyslexia.

articles.title: 4 expert insights on AI adoption across nonprofits in 2025
articles.author: Brandpoint
articles.summary: AI has proven to help people increase their productivity and impact at work. It's adoption across organizations of all sizes, including nonprofits, is a good thing.   .   Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, Email, Print, Copy and Paste, and Save

articles.title: 4 expert insights on AI adoption across nonprofits in 2025
articles.author: Brandpoint
articles.summary: AI has proven to help people increase their productivity and impact at work. AI is being adopted across organizations of all sizes, including nonprofits.   ¬†  √Ç   i.e. it's a tool that can be used by people of all ages.

articles.title: Bridgeline Digital, Inc. (BLIN) Partners with Leading JanSan Distributor to Enhance Digital Customer Experience with AI-Powered HawkSearch
articles.author: Ghazal Ahmed
articles.summary: Bridgeline Digital, Inc. (NASDAQ:BLIN) is a leader in AI-powered marketing technology solutions. On January 9, the company announced that it has partnered with HawkSearch, a search engine that helps businesses power digital experiences. HawkSearch was chosen by a leading distributor in the Janitorial and Sanitation industry.

articles.title: Heber City looks to AI tools as community grows
articles.author: Kpcw
articles.summary: Heber leaders were surprised to see an AI-generated video of the city manager at their annual retreat Thursday evening, Jan. 16. Matt Brower said the future of local government must include artificial intelligence. In 2025, he plans to create guidelines for the city to use AI ethically and transparently.

articles.title: Microsoft Tests AI-Powered Search in Windows 11
articles.author: archyde
articles.summary: Microsoft's Windows 11 is getting a major upgrade with the addition of AI-powered features that are going to change the way we interact with our computers. One of the most exciting additions is the ability to search for files using natural language. Microsoft is also introducing a powerful new tool called Click to Do, which integrates directly into the Windows writing experience.

articles.title: Google Vertex AI RAG Engine: Simplify Large Language Model Grounding
articles.author: archyde
articles.summary: The Vertex AI RAG Engine is a powerful tool that makes it easy to integrate Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) into AI applications. It allows AI models to access and incorporate relevant, up-to-date details from external databases or documents during the generation process. Dr. Carter believes RAG has the potential to revolutionize the way we use AI.

articles.title: Artificial Intelligence In Education To Be Discussed In Bernards
articles.author: Alexis Tarrazi
articles.summary: Bernards Township Planning Board will hold its reorganization meeting on Tuesday at 7:30 p.m. in the Warren Craft Meeting Room at 1 Collyer Lane. The next BT Connect meeting will discuss Artificial Intelligence in Education on Wednesday, Jan. 22 from 7 to 8:30 pm at the Ridge High School Cafeteria.

articles.title: Artificial Intelligence in Drug Discovery Market Set to Reach USD 12.02 Billion by 2032, Growing at a CAGR of 27.8%
articles.author: Pharmiweb
articles.summary: AI has significantly enhanced the efficiency and precision of pharmaceutical research. It has also brought immense benefits to the drug discovery process. AI's impact on Pharmaceutical Research and Drug Development is significant.    For confidential support call the Samaritans on 08457 909090 or visit a local Samaritans branch or click here.

articles.title: Trump officials to receive secret briefing on ‚Äòsuper agent' AI breakthrough
articles.author: Matthew Field
articles.summary: Sam Altman, the founder of OpenAI, will give a private briefing to US government officials next week on the latest developments in artificial intelligence (AI) technology. Silicon Valley executives from Facebook, Uber and TikTok will attend Donald Trump's inauguration on Monday. Mr Altman will make a $1m personal donation to Mr Trump's fund.

articles.title: One UI 7 Beta Receives Extraordinary Interest from Tech Reviewers
articles.author: archyde
articles.summary: One UI 7 beta has taken the tech world by storm. Samsung's new version of its mobile operating system features cutting-edge technology with intuitive design and advanced AI integration. The official release of One UI 7 is set to align with the launch of Samsung's latest Galaxy S Series devices.

articles.title: Be Polite To AI. Your Future Self Will Thank You
articles.author: Michael Ashley
articles.summary: Pew Research found that more than half of Americans interact with AI regularly. Isaac Asimov established the Three Laws of Robotics in his science fiction novel I, Robot. In the year 2025, we must ask ourselves what moral obligations we have to our AI counterparts and act politely to them.

articles.title: I went to the Alps to test Honor's AI Super Zoom camera and the results are both fascinating and frightening
articles.author: Axel Metz
articles.summary: Honor's Magic 7 Pro smartphone has a new AI feature called AI Super Zoom. It's a cloud-based feature that uses artificial intelligence to create 'crystal-clear' images of landscapes and urban architecture landscapes. It doesn't work well in low light or at night.

articles.title: Jan. 20 - New Indiana chamber report on artificial intelligence touts benefits to embracing the technology
articles.author: Tony Spataro
articles.summary: The report 'Seizing the Economic Power of Artificial Intelligence' was released by the Indiana Chamber Foundation on Jan. 17. It follows up on the AI Leadership Summit at the Rally innovation conference last year. It highlights the tangible benefits to employers and the state in adopting the technology. It is expected to unlock $87 billion in economic value by 2038.

articles.title: No complaining for a month from Blue Monday? ‚ÄòLetting off steam for five minutes is fine'
articles.author: archyde
articles.summary: As we step into 2025, the world of digital imagery continues to evolve at a breathtaking pace. From high-resolution displays to AI-driven photo enhancements, the advancements are reshaping how we capture, view, and interact with images. On-demand content is king and the integration of artificial intelligence in content creation is revolutionizing content creation.

articles.title: If AI Is So Efficient, Why Is Worker Productivity Such A Problem?
articles.author: Forbes
articles.summary: Artificial Intelligence can do a lot of things, but is it truly allowing workers to be more productive in the workplace? It's hard to say. It's still not clear if it's helping workers to do more in work. It can be useful, but it's not completely reliable.

articles.title: AI chatbots still can't accurately answer high-level history questions: study
articles.author: Ariel Zilber
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence-powered learned language models struggled to get basic facts right about ancient Egypt, according to a study. Researchers tested OpenAI's GPT-4, Meta's Llama and Google's Gemini using a newly developed benchmark called Hist-LLM. The benchmark relies on the Seshat Global History Databank.

articles.title: If AI Is So Efficient, Why Is Worker Productivity Such A Problem?
articles.author: Greg Petro
articles.summary: Artificial Intelligence can do a lot of things, but it can't keep humans from distractions like social media and the tyranny of now. 80% of employees can't go an hour without being distracted, two-thirds check messages and emails more than 10 times a day, and nearly 7 of 10 employees reported experiencing burnout in the previous year.

articles.title: Cognizant Taps Nerve With Neuro AI Multi-Agent Accelerator
articles.author: Adrian Bridgwater
articles.summary: Cognizant developed a tool to help organizations develop AI agents. Cognizant has 350,000 technology professionals working on digital transformation projects across industries including life sciences, communications, financial services and the automotive sector. The company hopes its technology will be harnessed to corral the use of autonomous agent networks in enterprise workflows.

articles.title: Here's why AI is a go-to at Chemistry, Pittsburgh's biggest ad agency
articles.author: Patty Tascarella
articles.summary: Chemistry is Pittsburgh's largest advertising agency and the region's fastest-growing company by revenue. It started using AI a year ago to improve ADA compliance of its website designs. The agency won Effie Award for marketing innovation in 2024 for Frontdoor Inc., a client in the home warranty business.

articles.title: China's humanoid robot stuns experts with ‚Äòunreal' human-like gait
articles.author: Kaif Shaikh
articles.summary: Chinese robotics firm EngineAI has released a video of its humanoid robot SE01 walking outside the company's Shenzhen office. The video has gone viral and sparked discussions among tech experts. EngineAI was founded in October 2023 and is on a fast track to scale production to over 1,000 units annually by 2025.

articles.title: I've experienced the next era of AI, and I'm never going back
articles.author: Nadeem Sarwar
articles.summary: Deep Research is the first agentic AI product in the Gemini family. It's a research tool that allows you to create a search activity and have an AI do the research on your behalf. The result is presented in the form of a neatly-curated article, with appropriate headlines and tables.

articles.title: 2 No-Brainer Technology Stocks to Buy Right Now
articles.author: Geoffrey Seiler
articles.summary: Eight of the S&P 500's largest weightings are in technology or tech-adjacent stocks. Nvidia has become the leader in artificial intelligence (AI) infrastructure. Amazon's largest business is Amazon Web Services (AWS) cloud computing unit. Amazon uses AI to improve its e-commerce and logistics operations.

articles.title: How to Detect AI Writing
articles.author: Rachel Kane
articles.summary: Professor of strategic communications uses AI tools like ChatGPTP, Grammarly and EssayGenius to help his students with writing their own papers. He explains how to catch students who use AI to cheat in their papers and how to be smarter in spotting them.

articles.title: Tech and technique: Vermont artists on AI influence
articles.author: Kendall Claar
articles.summary: Jenn Karson uses artificial intelligence as a tool in her artistic process to explore the intersection between technology and the environment. Vermont Arts Council launched a survey asking artists their thoughts on AI. Almost 90% of survey participants say they're worried about at least one aspect of the tech.

articles.title: The Download: AI's coding promises, and OpenAI's longevity push
articles.author: Rhiannon Williams
articles.summary: The second wave of AI coding is here. OpenAI has created an AI model for longevity science. Cleaner jet fuel is one of MIT Technology Review's 10 Breakthrough Technologies for 2025. AI is speeding up the Pentagon's 'kill list'. Europol is cracking down on encryption.

articles.title: AI Boosts Smartphones Globally, But Why Africa Faces Challenges
articles.summary: Samsung, Apple, Honor, Oppo and Xiaomi have introduced some level of AI on their smartphones. TechCrunch reports that investments in generative AI raised $56 billion from VCs in 2024. Africa's smartphone market grew by 3% year-on-year in Q3 for 2024, reaching 18.4 million units.

articles.title: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman on the future of AI:
articles.author: Robert Lee
articles.summary: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman on the future of AI: "People will lose jobs, but many new jobs will be created, much better jobs". P.S. for more interesting stuff, check out Linus Substance's newsletter: "Finance meets Technology".

articles.title: Breaking news: AGI is not imminent!
articles.author: Gary Marcus
articles.summary: Influencers have gone wild lately claiming that AGI is imminent. Sam Altman himself hinted we were close two weeks ago, but today he walked it back. Gary Marcus stands by his prediction that we will not see AGI in 2025, and regrets that Elon Musk didn't take his million dollar bet.

articles.title: ChatGPT's new customization options are exactly what I've been waiting for to make my chats more personal
articles.author: Graham Barlow
articles.summary: OpenAI has introduced new customization features to ChatGPT. The new features are rolling out now in the browser-based version and on desktop on Windows. The release currently doesn't cover users in the EU, Norway, Iceland Liechtenstein, and Switzerland. OpenAI says the new features will be coming to desktop on MacOS in the next few weeks.

articles.title: üìΩ Webinar: Building AI Agents with Fine-tuned SLMs
articles.author: Ksenia Se
articles.summary: Marsh McLennan built advanced AI agents to transform their business operations. They save their teams over a million hours annually. The webinar will be held on January 29th, 10am - 11am PT. It will cover topics such as AI agents and high-performance agentic workflows.

articles.title: Thread by @deepseek_ai on Thread Reader App
articles.summary: DeepSeek-R1 is a fully open-source model and technical report. It is MIT licensed for clear open access. API outputs can be used for fine-tuning and distillation. It costs $0.14 per million input tokens and $2.19 per million output tokens.

articles.title: Sam Altman tells AI fans to lower their expectations as rumors swirl OpenAI is on the brink of superintelligence
articles.author: Beatrice Nolan
articles.summary: Rumors that OpenAI has achieved artificial general intelligence (AGI) have been gaining traction on social media. Sam Altman quashes the online "hype" and warns fans to cut their expectations by "100x" about the company's progress in AI research.

articles.title: Can AI fix our pothole problem? Government believes so... but drivers are dubious
articles.author: The Daily Mail
articles.summary: Keir Starmer revealed the UK Government AI Opportunities Action Plan last week. Artificial intelligence will be deployed to help improve Britain's persistent and rising pothole problem.   ¬†  .   "Artificially intelligent vehicles will be used to help with the problem of potholes.

articles.title: Paul Schrader Says He Asked ChatGPT for Film Ideas and They Were All ‚ÄòOriginal' and ‚ÄòFleshed Out': ‚ÄòWhy Should Writers Sit Around for Months' When ‚ÄòAI Can Provide One in Seconds?'
articles.author: Ellise Shafer
articles.summary: ChatGPT has been used by Paul Schrader to generate plots for movies by famous filmmakers, including Paul Thomas Anderson, Quentin Tarantino, Harmony Korine, Ingmar Bergman, Rossellini, Scorsese, Murnau, Capra, Ford, Speilberg and Lynch. The AI platform has been a frequent subject on Schrader's Facebook page recently.

articles.title: Navigate the Optimization Trap
articles.author: Buyology
articles.summary: Instagram is introducing Edits, a new video editing app, and expanding Reel lengths to 3 minutes. Neurons AI gives you quick, actionable recommendations to improve your creatives and maximize your ad impact. Instagram is trying to compete with TikTok, especially in the U.S.

articles.title: The second wave of AI coding is here
articles.author: Will Douglas Heaven
articles.summary: Generative AI is good for understanding what's wrong with code and fixing it. Copilot, a tool built on top of OpenAI's large language models and launched by GitHub in 2022, is used by millions of developers around the world. Anthropic, Anthropic's Claude and ChatGPT, and Google DeepMind's Gemini are general-purpose chatbots. New startups like Zencoder, Merly, Cosine, Tessl, and Poolside are jostling for their slice of the pie.

articles.title: Spain to Grant $155 Million in Subsidies to Help Companies Develop AI
articles.author: Reuters
articles.summary: Spain's government will grant additional subsidies totalling 150 million euros ($155 million) for companies to boost the use and integration of artificial intelligence, Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez said on Monday. The subsidies will be aimed at boosting the use of AI technology in the country.

articles.title: Jefferies Names Broadcom Inc. (AVGO) Top Pick for 2025, Citing Rapid AI Chip Market Growth and $60B Revenue Potential
articles.author: Ghazal Ahmed
articles.summary: Broadcom Inc. (NASDAQ:AVGO) is a technology company uniquely positioned in the AI revolution owing to its custom chip offerings and networking assets. Jefferies named Broadcom as a top pick, saying that the semis company is a top idea in 2025. The firm raised its price target on the stock to $300 from $225.

articles.title: This Is Why AI Was Invented
articles.author: aka.attrition
articles.summary: As an Amazon Associate I Earn from Qualifying Purchases I earn money from this video. It's why AI was invented, as it's shown in the video below. It was posted by Clown World on January 19, 2025. It is a must watch video.

articles.title: UK plans powerful supercomputer to rival US, China in drug discovery
articles.author: Ameya Paleja
articles.summary: The UK government has invested $275 million in building Isambard-AI, the fastest supercomputer in the UK. The supercomputer will leverage artificial intelligence to find new drugs and vaccines and has already hit the ground running. It is 10 times faster than the existing supercomputers in UK and one of the top 10 most powerful in the world. AI could also help deliver public services more efficiently in UK.

articles.title: Where is Apple Intelligence on my Mac?
articles.author: Mac World
articles.summary: Apple Intelligence arrived on the Mac in October 2024. It's a set of features and services throughout the Mac that you need to update to the latest version of the Mac to get the latest features. It works only in English-speaking countries. It does not work on M-series Macs purchased in mainland China. To use ChatGPT, the extension needs to be activated or turned off.

articles.title: Morgan Stanley Raises AppLovin Corporation (APP) Price Target to $365, Citing AI-Driven Growth in E-Commerce and Gaming Ads
articles.author: Ghazal Ahmed
articles.summary: Applovin Corporation (NASDAQ:APP) provides a leading marketing platform powered by AI technology. Morgan Stanley analyst Matthew Cost raised the firm's price target on Applovin to $365 from $200 and kept an 'Equal-Weight' rating on the shares. The company ranks 5th on our list of the top AI stocks.

articles.title: Artificial Integrity, Not Intelligence, Prioritizes Humanity Over Autonomy
articles.author: Hamilton Mann
articles.summary: A few days ago, Stefano contacted the customer support team of an online retailer through their AI-powered chatbot. Stefano was impressed by the efficiency of the chatbot, but he found out that it prioritized premium customers over regular users. Ana installed a smart thermostat in her apartment to save on energy costs and ensure her home stayed comfortable for her children. Ana's building's AI energy system optimized heating efficiency but ignored individual circumstances.

articles.title: Cisco wants to utilize AIto keep your new applications and data safe
articles.author: Sead Fadilpa≈°iƒá
articles.summary: Cisco has unveiled a new solution aimed at helping businesses build, deploy, and secure, Artificial Intelligence-powered (AI) applications. Cisco AI Defense addresses two key risks - developing, and deploying, secure AI applications. The new tool will become available to enterprises in March 2025.

articles.title: Unlike most AI, Apple Intelligence is already making everything better
articles.author: Mac World
articles.summary: Apple came late to the AI party and is keen to catch up. The new iPhone SE will probably boast an A17 Pro processor and 8GB of RAM. The 11th-gen iPad will enjoy an even bigger step up from the A14 to the A17. Macs got a bump to 16GB in the fall and Predictive Code Completion in Xcode 16, part of the Apple Intelligence suite, requires 16GB.

articles.title: This Week In AI Chips - GSI Technology Powers Army AI Innovations with Gemini-II
articles.author: Simply Wall St
articles.summary: GSI Technology has been selected for a U.S. Army SBIR contract to develop edge AI computing solutions. Intel is leveraging advanced technologies and AI product lines to enhance profitability and market share. Simply Wall St has a list of 52 AI Chip Stocks.

articles.title: ‚ÄòThe Brutalist' used AI to augment Adrian Brody's performance, editor reveals
articles.author: NME
articles.summary: The Brutalist used Artificial Intelligence to augment dialogue within one scene, the film's editor has revealed. D√°vid Jancs√≥ says it's controversial in the industry to talk about AI, but it shouldn't be, as it's good for the industry.

articles.author: MENA FN
articles.summary: The rapid spread of artificial intelligence has people wondering who's most likely to embrace AI in their daily lives. Many assume it's the tech-savvy, but who's it really is? It's not who you think. It's who you want it to be.

articles.title: Samsung's Galaxy S25 Ultra Will Lead The Next Smartphone Revolution
articles.author: Forbes
articles.summary: Samsung will update Galaxy AI with the Galaxy S25 Ultra and S25. Samsung will also update Galaxy S20 and S20 Plus. Samsung is developing an AI-powered smartphone. Samsung wants to define AI phones in 2025 and beyond. Samsung plans to release Galaxy AI in 2018.

articles.title: OpenAI CEO Altman waters down fans' online hype on AGI
articles.author: Cryptopolitan
articles.summary: Rumors circulated online that ChatGPT maker OpenAI had achieved General Artificial Intelligence (AGI) behind the scenes. Sam Altman has watered down fans' wild online speculation about his company's capabilities.   ¬†  .   "It was great to keep our expectations grounded"

articles.title: Google AI Undermines Trump's Inauguration in Latest Act of Defiance
articles.author: Gabriela Pariseau
articles.summary: Gemini chatbot refused to answer basic questions about President Donald Trump's 2025 inauguration. It's a stark contrast to OpenAI's ChatGPT and X's Grok. Free Speech America's Dan Schneider accused Google of playing politics. Gemini's image-generating tool also produced racially and historically inaccurate images.

articles.title: Sam Altman Says AI Takeoff in Small Number of Years Not Months or a Decade
articles.author: Brian Wang
articles.summary: Sam Altman, the CEO of OpenAI, is more confident of a fast AI takeoff than he was a couple of years ago. He suggested this could happen within a small number of years rather than a decade. This indicates a shift in his perspective towards AI development.

articles.title: 4 expert insights on AI adoption across nonprofits in 2025
articles.author: Ashley Murray
articles.summary: Rahul Rao is the co-president and chief technology officer at Understood.org. He predicts that in 2025, AI will be a central part of nonprofit organizations' operations. AI has been a transformative tool for Understood, helping teams working across core functions like fundraising, community outreach, and research drive a major impact.
